translated: The Mansion Chapter
The Divine Man🔽The Well-Placed Chapter
The Mansion with the Jewel Pillars
“This lofty mansion with jewel pillars
extends twelve leagues in every direction.
It has seven hundred upper rooms,
with bejeweled pillars, lovely and well-built.
There you live, drink, and eat,
and divine flutes play a lovely tune.

analyzed: dibbāḥ rasāḥ kāma guṇā ittha pañca
translated: There are divine flavors, and the five kinds of heavenly music,
and golden-complexioned women dance.
Who are you, sir, with such a radiant appearance?

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca te sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: Your appearance shines in all directions.”
The god was pleased and said,
This is the result of that action.

analyzed: aham manussesu manussa bhūtaḥ  vivane pathe saṅkamanam akāsi
translated: “When I was a human being,🔽I built a bridge on a desolate path.
I planted trees in parks and gardens,
and I loved those who were virtuous.

analyzed: annam ca pānam ca pasanna cittaḥ
translated: With a serene mind, I respectfully
gave a great deal of food and drink as a gift.
Because of that, I have such a radiant appearance,

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca me sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and my appearance shines in all directions.”
The Mansion of the Jewel Chest is the third.
